intervals.description: Replace engine oil and clean oil strainer. Warm engine first for complete drain. Liquid-cooled 276cc engine requires strict oil change schedule for longevity.
Drain and replace final drive gear oil. Check drain and fill plugs for metal debris indicating gear wear.
intervals.torque_spec: Drain plug: 9 lb-ft (12 Nm), Fill plug: 9 lb-ft (12 Nm)

intervals.description: Remove CVT cover and inspect drive belt for cracks, fraying, glazing, and width. The 276cc engine puts more stress on the belt than 125cc models — inspect carefully.
Replace CVT drive belt regardless of condition. Inspect variator and clutch faces for wear or scoring at the same time.
Remove variator and inspect roller weights for flat spots, uneven wear, or reduced diameter. Replace as a set if any roller is out of spec. 300cc models use heavier rollers than 125cc.
Remove and clean air filter element. Replace element every 8,000 km or sooner if damaged. Inspect more frequently in dusty conditions.
Replace spark plug. Check electrode condition, carbon fouling, and gap before install.
Check and adjust intake and exhaust valve clearances with engine cold. Intake: 0.10-0.15mm, Exhaust: 0.18-0.23mm.
Drain and replace engine coolant. Bleed air from system after refill. Check hoses and clamps for leaks or deterioration.
intervals.fluid_spec: Long-life coolant (ethylene glycol based, 50/50 premix) — 1.0L total capacity

intervals.description: Replace front and rear brake fluid. Bleed system completely until fluid runs clear. Check hoses for cracking or swelling.
Check front and rear brake pad thickness. Replace when pad material reaches wear indicator groove or minimum thickness of 1.0mm. Heavier scooter wears pads faster.
Inspect and adjust throttle cable free play (2-6mm at grip). Lubricate cable with cable lubricant. Check for smooth operation through full range.
